byline.contributor: Mia Li and Yufan Huang contributed research.

abstract: American businesswoman Phan Phan-Gillis is formally arrested in China and charged with spying, following her six-month detention in southern China by state security officers; announcement of formal charges comes just before visit by Chinese Pres Xi Jinping to United States, and is expected to add to list of disputes that are overshadowing hopes for  fruitful discussions between Xi and Pres Obama.
lead_paragraph: The arrest gives Chinese investigators the power to hold Phan Phan-Gillis for two months while they decide whether to seek prosecution.

headline.main: China Formally Arrests U.S. Citizen Accused of Spying
headline.print_headline: China Formally Arrests Detained American Accused of Spying
